\title{ASC\sphinxhyphen{}bla}
\date{Sep 25, 2023}
\release{}
\author{J.\@{} Schoeberl}

\renewcommand{\releasename}{}

\begin{document}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
ASC\sphinxhyphen{}bla is a C++ library for basic linear algebra operations.
The library provides template classes \sphinxstylestrong{Vector} and \sphinxstylestrong{Matrix}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Installation is via git\sphinxhyphen{}clone:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{clone} \PYG{n}{https}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{github}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{com}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{TUWien}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{ASC}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{ASC}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{bla}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{git}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
To configure and build some tests do

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{ASC}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{bla}
\PYG{n}{mkdir} \PYG{n}{build}
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{build}
\PYG{n}{cmake} \PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}
\PYG{n}{make}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
To use ASC\sphinxhyphen{}bla in your code, set the compiler include path properly, and include the header files

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}include \PYGZlt{}vector.h\PYGZgt{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}include \PYGZlt{}matrix.h\PYGZgt{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
All objects are implemented in the namespace ASC\_bla. To use them with less typing, you can set

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{namespace} \PYG{n}{bla} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ASC\PYGZus{}bla}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
or even

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{using} \PYG{n}{namespace} \PYG{n}{ASC\PYGZus{}bla}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
You can create vectors and compute with vectors like:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Vector}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{k+kt}{double}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{y}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{z}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{k}{for}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{k+kt}{int}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{Size}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{+w}{   }\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{y}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mf}{5.0}
\PYG{n}{z}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{y}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{cout}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{z = }\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{z}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{endl}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For matrices you can choose between row\sphinxhyphen{}major (\sphinxtitleref{RowMajor}) or column\sphinxhyphen{}major (\sphinxtitleref{ColMajor}) storage,
default is row\sphinxhyphen{}major.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Matrix}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{k+kt}{double}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{RowMajor}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{m1}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{m2}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{k}{for}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{k+kt}{int}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{m1}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{Height}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{k}{for}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{k+kt}{int}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{j}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{j}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{m1}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{Width}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{j}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{m1}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{j}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{n}{j}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{m2}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mf}{3.7}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{Matrix}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{product}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{m1}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{m2}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
You can extract a rows or a columns from a matrix:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Vector}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{col1}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{product}\PYG{p}{.}\PYG{n}{Col}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
